And even with like chat GPT's in comparison, you you would say like make this, you know, change this one element and sometimes it would work and then sometimes it wouldn't and same with Google's previous models. in terms of how it takes whatever you're prompting it to change and making those changes. And I would say Adobe was still sort of the leader and you're saying Photoshopping, but like literally they were probably still leading the way in some of that editing versus again, going to one of these image models to do your editing. But now NanoBanana really sort of advanced the ball in terms of doing that. The second key feature and I think is the more exciting and really big deal is what's called visual memory.


So this is essentially where you can have from one image to the next, it persists as the same person, same object, same thing. And that has been the biggest flaw in image generation because you would see these little, even ads or short ads and like there would be a person but they'd slightly look different with like different bone structure or something in the next cut.
